sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Finland's military already trains with NATO member forces and it's well integrated with them. So formally joining would be straightforward.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And Finland's foreign minister played down Turkey's objections before the talks began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Well, I yesterday called to my good colleague Mevlut Savusoglu, the foreign minister, and a little bit to take the tensions down and we will also meet today and I'm sure that we will find a solution to this item.

sentences.sentence: Like Finland, Sweden was neutral during the Cold War, but in the next few days it will also announce whether it wants to join NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Russian troops continue to drop bombs in the besieged Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, where a small group of Ukrainian fighters have been battling for their lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After almost three long months inside the spawning complex, the battalion's family members are calling on world leaders, including China's premier, to intervene and lead evacuations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: lead evacuations. This wife of a serviceman says we asked Chinese President Xi Jinping to show great love, great concern for world values and great eastern wisdom, to join the rescue of the defenders of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: While Azovstal's defenders say they believe they are close to the end, high-level diplomatic negotiations, while painstakingly complex, have produced some positive outcomes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A convoy between 500 to 1,000 cars were finally given permission to leave the devastated port city Mariupol by the Russian military.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The displaced civilians arrived at the Ukrainian-held Zaporizhia on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Zelensky's soldiers continue to reclaim towns north of Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city. However, Moscow's defense ministry says Russia hit over 200 Ukrainian facilities on Saturday, including six command posts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As Russian troops retreat north, Ukrainian soldiers continue the grim task of recovering the remains of Putin's servicemen killed in battle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Officials say they uncovered at least 40 wood bodies from villages near Kharkiv on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: One of the many unwanted consequences of war is the disruption of all aspects of daily life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Scenes like this one have become increasingly common, not only here in Odessa, but also in other parts of southern Ukraine, where there is an acute shortage of fuel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

Especially it's been two years ago and we still don't have the answers. And we had other explosions like in 2005 and others. The Lebanese political system is complex and based on dividing religions.
